0.title: Engineering Intern
responsibilities: Created an AI agent using the Smolagents framework, enabling agentic RAG and querying a database to answer user questions.
Developed an AI assistant that live-corrects requirements written by engineers based on a predefined rule set.

1.title: Data Science Intern
responsibilities: Created a Python application to visualize CSV files and analyze them using AI.
Applied computer vision techniques to improve wafer production yield.
Processed and analyzed time series data using Pandas, Numpy, and Matplotlib.

2.title: Engineering Project (LLM Analysis)
responsibilities: Analyzed Large Language Models (LLMs) for instances of sexism.
Developed and implemented algorithms to detect biased language in LLM outputs.
Proposed solutions to mitigate gender bias in LLMs.

AI.title: CV Data Scientist
AI.objectiveText: Recent graduate in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, seeking a first job in Data Science / Artificial Intelligence.

0.title: Text Analysis and Automatic Classification
0.description: Implemented a Natural Language Processing pipeline using TF-IDF for feature extraction and a SVM classifier. Achieved over 87% accuracy in predicting sentence topics from the dataset.

1.title: License Plate Detection with YOLOv8
1.description: Fine-tuned the YOLOv8 model to detect license plates from surveillance camera images. Achieved 95% accuracy, allowing real-time recognition even in varying lighting conditions.

2.title: AI Project for an E-commerce Client
2.description: Developed a recommendation system using Machine Learning to analyze user behavior and suggest personalized products, increasing the conversion rate by 15%.

Sofware.title: CV Software Engineer
Sofware.objectiveText: Recent graduate in Computer Science and Networks, seeking a first job in embedded systems and software development.
Sofware.programmingLanguages: Programming Languages: C, C++, Python, Rust, SQL, Docker, git (CI/CD), Kubernetes (basic)

0.title: Sensor Reading via I2C and SPI
0.description: Programmed microcontrollers to read data from sensors connected via I2C and SPI. Data is collected and displayed on a small LCD screen.

1.title: Creation of a C Compiler Targeting RISC-V
1.description: Design and implementation of a C compiler based on Flex for lexical analysis and Bison for syntax analysis. The compiler translates source code resembling the C language into a RISC-V-type architecture.

2.title: Connected Weather Station
2.description: Created a small weather station with temperature, humidity, and pressure sensors. Data is collected by a microcontroller and sent via Wi-Fi to a simple interface for real-time monitoring.

0.title: Interactive Portfolio
